717548f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from and including 50th Street (incorrectly marked 48th Street on the face of the picture). The centre building is the American Horse Exchange, which within the next decade will be replaced by the Winter Garden Theatre.
March 18, 1901.
William B. Parsons Collection.
M..~ 2So9

717557f-a.text:
1639-1647 Broadway, west side, between 50th and 51st Streets. Between 1916 and 1920 this frame building will be replaced by the
Capitol Theatre.
February 25, 1904.
Brown Brothers.
Nea. ~2205
NVEO 350)

717553f-a.text:
Broadway, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of West 50th Street. Also shown is West 50th Street, north side, east from, but not including Broadway, to and including Sixth Ave. At the N.E. corner of Seventh Ave., and West 50th Street, is the Roxy Theatre, housed in the Hotel Manger (now the Hotel
Taft).
July 23, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

717549f-a.text:
Broadway at the S.W. corner of 50th Street. The three-story building shown will be replaced by a four-story structure.
February 5, 1928.

717550f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, west side, north from, but not including, 50th Street. The theatres shown are the Capitol, the Hollywood, and the Broadway,
in its new location.
NEG ~ 87e  October 1, 1933.

(2)
A more inclusive view, showing in addition the N.W. corner of West
50th Street.
NEG~ 5E2  October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3 and 4)
The same. The Capitol Theatre (Motion Picture) is at No. 1645 Broadway. This set consists of a positive and negative copy.
October to December 1935.

717554f-c.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, from 50th to 51st Streets, showing the Winter Garden Theatre flanked by buildings of three and twelve
stories, respectively.
May 3, 1930.

(2,and 3)
A similar view, more extensive southward. The Winter Garden Theatre bears No. 1634 Broadway. This set consists of a negative and
a positive.
November 29, 1935.
